intro: Inga cycladenia, commonly known as the cycad-like inga, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, butterfly-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Inga cycladenia is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological diversity in its native habitat.
